inexhaustible.英释: something that is inexhaustible exists in such large amounts that it can never be finished or used up

contamination.英释: the action or state of making or being made impure by polluting or poisoning

demonstration.英释: an act of explaining and showing how to do something or how something works

revolutionize.英释: to completely change the way people do something or think about something

deforestation.英释: the cutting or burning down of all the trees in an area

ideologically.英释: In a way that relates to ideas or an ideology, especially of a political or economic nature.

appropriation.英释: the act of taking control of something without asking permission

unprecedented.英释: If something is unprecedented, it has never happened before

conscientious.英释: careful to do everything that it is your job or duty to do

reimbursement.英释: If you receive reimbursement for money that you have spent, you get your money back, for example because the money should have been paid by someone else.

predominantly.英释: You use predominantly to indicate which feature or quality is most noticeable in a situation

mismanagement.英释: Someone's mismanagement of a system or organization is the bad way they have dealt with it or organized it

certification.英释: an official document that says that someone is allowed to do a certain job, that something is of good quality etc

qualification.英释: if you have a qualification, you have passed an examination or course to show you have a particular level of skill or knowledge in a subject

authorization.英释: official permission to do something, or the document giving this permission

comprehensive.英释: including all the necessary facts, details, or problems that need to be dealt with

specification.英释: a detailed instruction about how a car, building, piece of equipment etc should be made

alternatively.英释: You use alternatively to introduce a suggestion or to mention something different from what has just been stated.

disengagement.英释: Disengagement is a process by which people gradually stop being involved in a conflict, activity, or organization.

controversial.英释: causing a lot of disagreement, because many people have strong opinions about the subject being discussed

underestimate.英释: to think or guess that something is smaller, cheaper, easier etc than it really is

untrustworthy.英释: someone who is untrustworthy cannot be trusted

Automatically.英释: by the action of a machine, without a person making it work

collaborative.英释: a job or piece of work that involves two or more people working together to achieve something

denationalize.英释: to sell a business or industry that is owned by the state, so that it is then owned privately

indispensable.英释: someone or something that is indispensable is so important or useful that it is impossible to manage without them

sophisticated.中释: 复杂的，精密的；老于世故的
sophisticated.英释: a sophisticated machine, system, method etc is very well designed and very advanced, and often works in a complicated way

entertainment.英释: when you entertain someone at home, or for business

disappearance.英释: when someone or something becomes impossible to see or find

insignificant.英释: too small or unimportant to consider or worry about

questionnaire.英释: a written set of questions which you give to a large number of people in order to collect information

environmental.英释: concerning or affecting the air, land, or water on Earth

photoelectric.英释: using an electrical current that is controlled by light

perpendicular.英释: not leaning to one side or the other but exactly vertical
